title: Honoring Paul Watzka upon the occasion of his retirement from the Town of Ulster Police Department
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Paul  Watzka upon the occasion of his
retirement from the Town of Ulster Police Department

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this  Legislative  Body  to  recognize  and
honor  those  distinguished officers and citizens who would devote them-
selves to public service, demonstrating great courage and  diligence  in
providing  for the care and welfare of the citizens of their communities
and this great Empire State; and
  WHEREAS, Within every community of the State of  New  York  there  are
certain  individuals  who, by virtue of their commitment and dedication,
command the respect and admiration of their community  for  their  exem-
plary contributions and service on behalf of others; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Police Chief
Paul Watzka upon the occasion of his retirement in 2010 from the Town of
Ulster Police Department after 38 years of loyal service; and
  WHEREAS, Starting his career as a deputy for the Ulster  County  Sher-
iff's  Office in 1972, Paul Watzka joined the Kingston Police Department
the following year where he moved up the ranks from  officer  to  detec-
tive, then sergeant and later lieutenant; and
  WHEREAS,  Paul  Watzka  also  served as a deputy chief in the Kingston
department until ultimately being named  Ulster  Police  Chief  in  2001
where he remained until his retirement in 2010; and
  WHEREAS,  During his nine years with the town, Paul Watzka transformed
the department into the professional agency it is today; under his lead-
ership, the Ulster Police strived to fulfill, and met all  132  rigorous
standards  toward  earning  accreditation  from  the state Department of
Criminal Justice Services; and
  WHEREAS, Under the seasoned leadership of Paul Watzka,  Ulster  County
Police  Department  excelled  in  every aspect of professionalism in the
field of law enforcement; and
  WHEREAS, Described by co-workers as the epitome of a true law-enforce-
ment professional, Paul Watzka is more than just a  boss  to  those  who
work for him, he is a friend who is always understanding and fair; and
  WHEREAS,  With  him throughout have been his wife, Lu-Ann, and his two
loving daughters, Brittany and Kerri, all of whom feel privileged to  be
a part of his life and rejoice in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that those dedicated
public  servants  who unselfishly devote their lives to the preservation
of order and the protection of others are worthy and due full praise for
their commitment and noble endeavors; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Paul  Watzka  upon  the  occasion  of his retirement from Town of
Ulster Police Department; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Paul Watzka.
